attributes.action: Licence possession of all knives that have potential to harm.
attributes.background: Our licensing laws forbid guns in our drawers, so why can't our government push for a change? License the manufacturing and possession of potential weapons. Rounded edge knives only unless licensed.

attributes.action: Add metric km/h to speed signs under the imperial mph sign.
attributes.background: So as the Metric system is a lot easier to convert lengths through I think we should convert our measurements to km/h while keeping the mph sign for old road users. I think we should add the km/h sign under the mph road sign with a different coloured ring (green maybe) and km/h after it.
attributes.additional_details: This would make it easier to judge distance for younger people as younger people are being taught the metric system. As most cars have km/h along side mph this would mean it would have almost instant impact. Also it is great for tourists and european people that come from a totally metric county drive safer.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to get a licence to own an animal.
attributes.background: This is a petition to make anybody who wants to own any animal have a licence. There is so much animal abuse that goes on and this is a step in the right direction to start protecting innocent creatures. With a view to the licence fee being used to police animal cruelty at street level.
attributes.additional_details: The licence would ideally be linked with an animal abusers register that is also being petitioned for. Please remember that if nobody speaks up, nothing will change, and animals do not have a voice. We are their voice and we have to be heard. Thankyou.

attributes.action: Yarl's Wood should be closed down as unfit for purpose.
attributes.background: Hunger strikes, women put on planes in their nighties, children being reclassified as over 18.  This is a national shame.  Yarl's Wood has been an open sore for years now, the Sky News story,  'Immigration Centre Detainees 'treated like pigs'", 2/5/18 is one in a long line of stories
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/yarls-wood-inside-experience-hunger-strike-immigration-detention-scandal-a8230056.html

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/children-fleeing-warzones-being-locked-up-at-yarls-wood-detention-centre-investigation-finds-10337409.html

https://www.independent.co.uk/voices/windrush-generation-scandal-shappi-khorsandi-i-applaud-david-lammy-a8313906.html

attributes.action: Ban hunting for pheasants and other game birds. It is very cruel.
attributes.background: Hunting pheasants is just as bad as fox hunting in my opinion. This is a very very cruel sport. The poor birds are treated very badly and this needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details: There are many videos on YouTube which show how these poor birds suffer. Why? All for the entertainment of huntsmen. How would they feel? To be shot and left for dead?

attributes.action: Stop all councils from using enforcement agencies, bailiffs and threats of court
attributes.background: Council tax and poverty don't mix! If you are unable to pay on time you will be put into debt by your council. Theres no communication with customers they pass your bill to enforcement agencies with added fees,threats of ballifs,court and jail. If you believe this shouldn't be happening please sign.

attributes.action: Repeal Section 127 (1) of the 2003 Communications Act. Offence is not a crime.
attributes.background:
The Communications Act states: (1) A person is guilty of an offence if he 
(a) sends by means of a public electronic communications network a message or other matter that is GROSSLY OFFENSIVE or of an indecent, obscene or menacing character.
attributes.additional_details: Clearly, this is in breach of everybody's right to Freedom of Speech. Offence is an entirely subjective concept. For the state to be able to decide what is offensive, and then prosecute accordingly is tyrannical.

attributes.action: Non transitioned transgender* members of military serve as identified gender
attributes.background: Currently, transgender people must have completed transition to be treated as the gender they identify with. It takes years and years to fully transition, meaning some people may have their dreams of joining the British military destroyed. We should allow people to serve as who they are.
attributes.additional_details: Our country prides itself on tolerance and acceptance of all people, regardless of their sex, race, sexual orientation, religion, but why in the British military do we not accept them for their gender (change). Being treated as someone who you are not can make you feel extremely uncomfortable, dysphoric and could even lead to mental health issues. The UK army has recently had a "This is belonging" campaign, but why don't trans* people belong in their identified gender? Please change this

attributes.action: Create a Strategic Marine Resources Act
attributes.background:
Promote the protection of marine resources in the UK/British EEZ's
Safe guard UK fisheries within UK/British EEZ's post Brexit
Create and protect a sustainable asset for the UK
attributes.additional_details:
Under the UNCLOS each country has an EEZ and the protection of this natural resource is an important part of the members commitment.

The UK has no Strategic Fisheries Resources Act, and it does not have a Strategic Maritime Resources Act.

attributes.action: Hold a snap election in response to Theresa May's poor leadership over Syria.
attributes.background: Theresa May's decision to approve air strikes in Syria without consulting the British parliament should not go unchallenged. Her lack of consideration has called the safety of this country into question and put innocent lives of the Syrian people in danger.

attributes.action: Allow Ambulances on non-emergency journeys to use Bus Lanes.
attributes.background: Make a nationwide policy to allow NHS Ambulances on non-emergency journeys to use Bus Lanes at all times. This would recognise that Ambulance journeys are important.  Ambulances sitting in queues of traffic while Bus Lanes are free doesn't make much sense. This would save the NHS money.
attributes.additional_details: NHS ambulances are a form of public transport & should have the same right to use Bus Lanes as Buses & Taxis.

attributes.action: Change when employers can dismiss employees without cause back to one year.
attributes.background: The qualifying period for unfair dismissal increased from one to two years in April of 2012. This made it easy for a company to dismiss someone after less than two years' employment. You could work for a company for nearly two years and be dismissed for no apparent reason.
attributes.additional_details: You have no options once this happens as the company is not obligated to reinstate you, offer another position, and neither are you entitled to compensation outside their discretion which is quite often unsatisfactory. With the current system, good employees are left with no security.

attributes.action: Introduce Black History Month to the curriculum for primary and secondary school
attributes.background:
It is vital that we inform the younger generation of the struggles and injustice that was faced by black people. It is imperative that we are all aware of the past and the addition to the curriculum will give all races the opportunity to learn about the past. 

Through knowledge comes progression.

attributes.action: Question Cameron's decision to impose fundamental constitutional change
attributes.background: This nation is a representative democracy or at least it used to be. Then in 2016 David Cameron imposed a regime favoured by dictators and demagogues: decision by dint of a misinformed public–a referendum. An inquiry is needed to find out why he decided to impose fundamental constitutional change.
attributes.additional_details: Britain is in a political crisis brought about by the transfer of supreme authority from the electorate to the government. It is not true to say that the people decided to leave the EU, because that claim presumes that the electorate has followed the government's instruction that they must make the decision. For the government to instruct the electorate on how to vote & then instruct Parliament on how to interpret that vote is fundamentally undemocratic. Why was that instruction issued?

attributes.action: Allow adoption for adults over the age of 18 like in the USA
attributes.background: Adult adoption has been legal in most states of the USA since 2002. I am now 21 years of age and at an age where I feel I can make judgement on who MY father should be. The fact that I cannot be adopted my a man who has stood by me for years because I am “too old” is completely against my rights.
attributes.additional_details: I intend on getting the law changed so that myself and others can make this descision. Many people do it for different reasons. It should be a choice that can be made at any time in an adults life.

attributes.action: Make sensory rooms compulsory in schools and provide separate funding for it.
attributes.background: CAMHS is in a serious and worsening crisis and it is failing our children.   The first step to helping our children would be to equip our schools with sensory rooms.  This will be the foundation block for children with specialist learning needs, including autism and learning disabilities
attributes.additional_details:
Sensory rooms in schools will benefit our children hugely.  Please give your full support
https://www.experia-innovations.co.uk/blog/the-benefits-of-a-sensory-room/   
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/health/nhs-mental-health-services-children-turn-away-day-vulnerable-nspcc-study-a8047401.html
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/oct/24/mental-health-children-camhs-jeremy-hunt-nhs-tragedies-funding-cuts
What is a sensory room
https://www.green-modular.com/blog/sensory-rooms-schools/

attributes.action: Create a new Ministerial Department called the Department For a Fair Society.
attributes.background:
New technologies could benefit everyone but instead, they are often exploited for maximum corporate profit 
The DFFS should: 
a) Find and support technologies that can have a revolutionary positive impact on society
b) Champion them to other government departments, the press and business groups
attributes.additional_details:
Technology already exists that can break the vicious circle of poverty, give fair access to top quality education and healthcare, and end the exploitation of vulnerable people by unscrupulous business. Instead of trying to fix our broken economy, these technologies could be harnessed to create a new, ethical model that will not favour the rich over the poor or any other group over another.
The DFFS would lead the country, and the rest of the world, to a fairer, more inclusive model for society.

attributes.action: Change the law on drink driving to no drink at all while in charge of a vehicle
attributes.background: Stop drinking while driving completely, as in you cannot have any alcohol while in charge of any vehichle! To many people lose there loves one through someone else's irresponsible actions, yet all they get in return of taking a life is a couple years in prison at the most.
attributes.additional_details: We need a tougher punishment for this crime such as longer prison time and harsher license loss, if over the limit if you cause an accident it should be you lose your license for more than 5 years followed by a prison sentence minimum punishment. UK laws are to lax time to make them tougher. Save lives not lose them!!

attributes.action: Limit MP's to a total of 4 years in parliament to prevent career politicians.
attributes.background: A politician should only be allowed to serve 4 years (consecutive or not) in parliament to prevent the blatant complacency and contempt for the British public that has been on display for years.
attributes.additional_details:
A politician with a limited timescale has to make their term count. Would the country stall on any major decision if politicians knew they could do what they believed was best for the country without fear of losing their ‘golden goose’ career? 
Fresh blood is required to bring new ideas and a fresh perspective to the way this country is run. New and exciting representatives are out there waiting for their chance to make a difference for the country, and they should be given the chance.

attributes.action: Make a legal requirement for signs to be placed 1000m before a mobile speed trap
attributes.background: Make a legal requirement for temperary signs to be placed 1000m before a mobile speed camera. This is to insure the safety of officers who may be roadside performing speed checks. By making road users aware that officers and equipment will be near by, Drivers can make precautions when driving past.

attributes.action: Make health and nutrition a compulsory subject at Key Stage 2 and 3 level.
attributes.background: Childhood obesity is at its highest level ever in the UK and this is mainly due to a combination of lack of education in the majority of both adults and children, and misinformation spread by companies in order to sell products. By incorporating these subject in to KS2 and 3 it is providing the next
attributes.additional_details: Generation with the ability to make correctly informed choices about the foods they choose to consume.

attributes.action: Replace the compulsory subject of RE for basic level psychology and counselling.
attributes.background: We are in the middle of a mental health revolution. The world of psychology is making advances and stigmas are being broken down in society. Mental health effects everybody either directly or indirectly and it is our duty to make sure children are given the tools needed to deal with these issues.
attributes.additional_details: In our modern day of technology wasting precious educational time and taxpayers money to teach religion is outdated. Any teenager has access to the internet where they can learn about any religion to their hearts content. Instead with this time we can introduce teens to basic level psychology. To get children asking questions, growing their knowledge on issues and learning how to deal them. Many time it takes humans a while to learn about themselves so the more headstart we can give the better.

attributes.action: Make medical insurance compulsory for foreign nationals visiting the UK.
attributes.background: When visiting a foreign country, UK citizens are required to take out travel / medical insurance. This should be made compulsory for foreign nationals. This could save millions of pounds for the NHS.

attributes.action: Raise Firefighters' wages to a reasonable living wage (+ all emergency services)
attributes.background: The fire fighters are real life heroes risking their own life and limb, running into danger, for the sake of others and their property. Their wages, along with ALL other emergency service workers, have been frozen and capped instead of being given the recognition they deserve.
attributes.additional_details:
Statement of a firefighter: “Personally I go to work to earn money to provide for my family and myself.  In my mind all public services work extremely hard (Police, Fire, Ambulance or our nurses and doctors).  Our pay was frozen, then capped at 1% whilst inflation has risen at about 3%, our pension contributions have risen and the NI contributions we pay so, in effect, our wages have dropped.” 

ALL emergency services deserve a decent living wage and appropriate funding for volunteer agencies.

attributes.action: Remove the 'minimum ban' on drink drivers and replace with a lifetime ban
attributes.background:
Currently the law in the UK states that drink driving offenders MAY GET, 6 months’ imprisonment, 
an unlimited fine, a driving ban for at least 1 year (3 years if convicted twice in 10 years)
attributes.additional_details:
These dangerous people should be taken off the road for good and the penalties for those who offend should be a lot stricter. An example must be made.
Almost 1 in 4 drink driving offenders return to court for the same offence in the UK.

attributes.action: Government to make lie detector tests compulsory for suspects.
attributes.background: The main aim of this petition is to persuade government and parliament to make lie detector tests complusory on suspects also lie detector tests should be carried out without the permission of suspects as a routine check.
attributes.additional_details: Innocent lives are lost and the families want to find out who the suspect may have been. Cases of crime and violence will be easier to resolve and justice will be given to innocent families.

attributes.action: Government to take back FULL control of the Rail Network, end Privatisation!
attributes.background:
In recent years, the uk Rail Network has seen reckless actions in regards to weak bids that have fallen through, clauses that have cost millions of pounds and numerous bail outs & takeovers that where unnecessary, or preventable! 

We feel it’s time the the UK regains control of its train network
attributes.additional_details:
The state of the Bidding process is flawed, calling for multiple amendments and cost franchisees and the taxpayer millions of pounds.

It seems to be that operators are more interested in making money than seeing the needs of its key objectives that involve passengers and rail infrastructure!

The state of the past and present of the East Coast Mainline, Great Western Mainline, and many other areas of UK Franchises having final warnings or ‘Bail outs’.

It’s time the UK Rail became Public again!

attributes.action: Mobility scooters users should be licenced, insured and pass a handling test.
attributes.background: To help prevent more members of the general public being injured, as i was recently, by one of these large, heavy, unregulated vehicles driven without due care in public places.

attributes.action: Make high blood pressure tablets free on the NHS
attributes.background: Over 5 million people have high blood pressure and it affects more than 1 in 4 adults and is one of the biggest risk factors for premature death and disability in England.High blood pressure can lead to diseases including heart disease, stroke, vascular dementia and chronic kidney disease.
attributes.additional_details: People who treat their diabetes with tablets, injection therapies or insulin are entitled to free prescriptions – but if you're in England you'll need to have a medical exemption certificate to claim your free prescription unless you're aged 60 or over. High blood pressure affects more people and have the same potential to kill a sufferer as someone with diabetes. High blood pressure sufferers right across the UK should be treated equally and fairly as diabetics and get free medication

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to rejoin the EU before June 30th 2019
attributes.background: UK voted to leave the EU and has the chance to view what life outside the EU is like post 29th March 2019. If it is good then we can vote to stay outside the EU, if not we can vote to apply to rejoin as a full member of the EU.
attributes.additional_details: There is much debate about the possible negative effect of leaving the EU in March 2019. The UK will know shortly afterwards what the real effect has been and should be given the chance to rejoin again if there has been damage caused which will become worse the longer it continues, hence the referendum must take place within 3 months of leaving.

attributes.action: The N.H.S should fund properly regulated homeopathy clinics.
attributes.background: Millions around the world and in the U.K choose homeopathy instead of mainstream medicine, until recently the N.H.S funded some G.P's who prescribed homeopathic remedy's but the N.H.S has now stopped this.

attributes.action: Introduce a national agency to perform detailed 'anti-money laundering' testing
attributes.background:
Anti money laundering (AML) checks are required by banks, and also legal advisers, accountants etc
Given a desire to reduce the UK as a destination for 'dirty money' rules could be tighter
AML checks are hard to carry out meaningfully and are already time consuming
attributes.additional_details:
A single agency could improve on the status quo by:
- removing duplication
- unbiased approach
- removing competitive pressures to cut rigour ('all our other [x] accepted this, why don't you?')
- speeding up transactions by pre-approval
- ability to see full picture of all UK investments when testing source of funds

Scheme could be self-funding by charging fees

Data security:
- replace info being gathered and held by multiple parties
- no need to disclose full details when issuing certificate

attributes.action: Please remove age restriction in s3(5) of the British Nationality Act
attributes.background: Our son was denied an application to register as a British citizen because he had just turned 18, and informed by Home Office that his only path to citizenship was settlement / ILR (£2389 + Life in UK test £50) followed by naturalisation (£1330 + £20 for biometrics + £80 citizenship ceremony).
attributes.additional_details: Please remove the age restriction to register as a British citizen in section 3(5) birth abroad to parents who are British by descent but now domiciled in UK. Why does the entitlement under British Nationality law end upon reaching the age of 18? Article 8 / Human Rights Act 1998 and UN Declaration on Human Rights state inter alia "The family is the natural and fundamental group unit of society and is entitled to protection by society and the State."

attributes.action: Attach a mandatory Prison term to every charged Drink Driving case
attributes.background: Charged Drink Driving offences rarely carry any prison sentence and those with the money can easily afford any fine or ban. Adding a mandatory jail sentence should again make people think twice regardless of their status.
attributes.additional_details: Celebrities getting off with just fines and bans.

attributes.action: Allow on call and volunteer emergency personnel to use green flashing lights.
attributes.background: Allowing on call and volunteer emergency personnel to use green flashing lights would make them more noticeable to other vehicles. This would help minimise delays while they are trying to get to their respective station. Delays cost lives!
attributes.additional_details: Green flashing lights can currently be used by doctors. These lights don't give any exemption to traffic laws, but do highlight the importance of the journey. This means that vehicles are more likely to let them past than if they had no lighting.

attributes.action: Cancel HS2 and use the allocated funds to help find a cure for cancer.
attributes.background: The debate on the long term benefits of HS2 and the use of an estimated £56bn of public funds on such a project have been going on for sometime. If the British public actually had a vote, would it be in favour of spending £56bn on HS2 or helping find a cure for cancer !
attributes.additional_details:
My mother has been battling with cancer for the last few years with the aid of vital treatments however a cure still doesn't exist and sadly  she has now been given months if not weeks to live as she is no longer responding to treatment.

A close family friend who stands to lose everything he's worked for much like countless others due to the HS2 project made a point that perhaps the funds could be better spent on something that could truly benefit each and everyone for generation to come.

attributes.action: Make feminine hygiene products free.
attributes.background: Women are expected to pay a significant amount of their income each month to pay for essential feminine hygiene products. The process women go through is completely natural and not their choice. The idea that they pay for such necessary products while contraception can be free is ridiculous.
attributes.additional_details: The average woman's income annually is £22,381. Take out their tax and their personal allowance. They spend £2,160 approximately on food annually and approx £492 annually on feminine hygiene products. That's money that could be better spent on themselves or on their families. For low income women and students who struggle to eat, this is atrocious. They are still finding the money to look after their bodies. The government should start to pay for such products.

attributes.action: Ask the EU under Article 50(3) TFEU to extend the period before Brexit
attributes.background: Our future as a global trading nation hangs on our future relationship with the EU. That is far from certain and we need time to develop it. Once we leave the EU, our position will be weaker across the board. We should not  burn that bridge and move into the transition without more clarity.
attributes.additional_details: During the proposed transition, the UK will be a rule-taker, not a rule-maker. It will be able to sign – but not implement- trade agreements with partners outside the EU. There is no clear evidence of the availability, terms or value of such deals, and potential partners will wish to know the UK's future relationship with the EU before committing themselves. The Transition is too uncertain. We should not leave our existing terms with the EU before we are sure we are headed for a better future.

attributes.action: Don't allow councils to use private companies as Civil Enforcement Officers
attributes.background: Councils are subcontracting their Enforcement Officers to private companies. It has been highlighted in the news and in a damning panorama report, private companies are out for profit and cannot make the right moral decisions. These powers need to remain with local council Civil Enforcement Officers
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39882434

attributes.action: Conduct rolling referenda so that the Brexit deal commands support AT THE TIME
attributes.background: Older voters, who were more likely to have died by the time 'Leave' takes effect, tended to favour 'Leave', whilst those under the age of 18, who will live much longer with the consequences, didn't get a vote at all.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposal is to conduct a potentially rolling sequence of referenda to ensure that the final outcome from the Brexit negotiations reflects the widest possible support AT THE TIME THE FINAL DEAL COMES INTO EFFECT.

There are 4 options. 1. Take the deal. 2. Re-negotiate 3. Stay in the EU 4. Leave with no agreement.

The voters rank the options in order of preference.

When one option commands more than 50 percent of the votes, or if the top option is 2, re-negotiate, that's what HMG will action.

Otherwise the option with the fewest votes is eliminated, and its supporters' votes are re-allocated to their next preferences.

If option 2, re-negotiate, wins, there would have to be a further referendum 3 months later, conducted as above.

attributes.action: Invite Vladimir Putin to the UK to discuss UK-Russia relations
attributes.background:
Britain's most famous Prime Minister Winston Churchill said "Jaw Jaw is better than War War". 
If he refuses to come it will speak volumes. If he does come maybe we can avert a tit-for-tat escalation.

attributes.action: Stop 'Treatment Without Consent' in the Mental Health Act
attributes.background: If patients with physical illnesses such as cancer can refuse treatment mental health patients should also be able to do the same. The current practice of using the Mental Health Act to force treatment is coercive and a violation of the autonomy of the patient.
attributes.additional_details: The current practice of psychiatry is almost exclusively based on a biochemical model. The outcome of this is that medication is seen as the only credible resort when treating patients suffering from psychotic illness. When patients suffer side effects they are seen as non-compliant and when they stop medication they are placed on CTOs. This violates the patient's autonomy to make decisions for themselves about their treatment.

attributes.action: Make bullying awareness part of the national curriculum in all schools.
attributes.background: I feel too many children are suffering from bullying on a daily basis, and not enough action is being done. Yes schools have posters about zero tolerance on bullying, but how many kids actually pay attention. I feel a minimum of 30 minutes a week classroom time will make children more aware.
attributes.additional_details: I have never struggled with bullying personally, but after reading a heart breaking story of a young boy, who sadly took his own life due to bullying, I feel it is time to integrate bullying awareness into children's lives, and the ideal place for this to take place is in the classroom, across all ages and all schools. I strongly believe a bullying awareness curriculum in schools could lower this stigma and ideally save lives.

attributes.action: Review the way interest is added to student loans.
attributes.background: Many young people will never afford to pay back their student loan.  Not only does the current system saddle young people with debt, it is not good for their mental health to know the loan is being added to monthly. The proposal here is to review the student loan interest system.
attributes.additional_details: Reducing interest rates, to be in line with the current Bank of England interest rate plus running cost of a non profit making company, seems to be a much better prospect for young people. The government will have to pick up the bill for any remaining loan, once the student is 53 years old. Let’s make a system work where young people can realistically pay their loans off or a system where the government subsidises all loans.

attributes.action: Create a National Care Service
attributes.background:
This country needs a sister service to the NHS to focus on social care 

Care of vulnerable and elderly citizens 

Giving  social care a new and unique identity 

This new service would create new and specialised employment with career paths offering a rewarding career with decent pay
attributes.additional_details:
Social care has a poor image , often seen as low paid casual work 
But yet so vital in this age of an older generation 
A new identity a new structure 
With new career paths is needed

attributes.action: Government to fund a rail/bus discount card for those in education until age 18.
attributes.background: My friend's 16-year-old daughter is starting college this year and will need to travel by train and as there is no other alternative she has had to purchase an adult season ticket at huge expense.
attributes.additional_details:
As all children are expected to remain in education until the age of 18 it is unfair that their parents should have to pay full adult rail and bus fares for them.

Because our train and bus companies are all privately owned it is very difficult to ask them to change their policies, however, I do believe that the Government has a duty of care to all students and those undertaking low paid apprenticeships and I would like to ask Government to consider funding a student/young persons rail/bus discount card thereby helping to reduce travelling costs for parents.

attributes.action: Increase nhs staff awareness and training on the signs and symptoms of sepsis
attributes.background:
I have since heard of many other cases of children with sepsis being misdiagnosed having gastroenteritis, sometimes with long term effects. 
I want government to look at this issue and increase training awareness within the nhs to prevent more unnecessary child deaths or life changing effects.
attributes.additional_details:
Our son, had severe leg pain, a very high temperature, vomiting and neck stiffness. We called 111 who sent us an ambulance to a and e. When we arrived, were seen by the doctor, he took a brief look over our son and asked of his symptoms. We said the symptoms, then he concluded that it could be gastroenteritis. He said we could take him home if he could keep some food down, which he did. However I said I was very concerned as he could not sit up unaided at this point and I would like another opinion. The paedeatrician came and immediately suggested meningitis and sepsis. He took bloods immediately and put our son onto strong antibiotics (this saved his life). The bloods later came back as positive for meningococcal septaceamia. 
Without fast treatment for Sepsis, it can be fatal.

attributes.action: Ban the riding of bicycles while walking dogs.
attributes.background: On a regular basis, I see people riding a bicycle while they take their dog for a walk. This is highly dangerous if the dog wants to stop to do their business as on many occasions, the rider is not even paying attention to their dog, which could cause severe injury to the dog.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for all NHS staff
attributes.background: NHS staff are dedicated and commited to providing excellent healthcare for all people, however on the low wages they receive it seems only fair that they can take care of themselves too as a thank you.

attributes.action: Free Meals For All Kids in Primary Schools
attributes.background: Kids in Primary School should have free Schools meals. If the Prisoners have free meals why kids can’t have them too.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe that should be addressed and actioned! 
Please sign my petition and let all kids have a free warm meal at school.
